meanings.definition: A circle on the celestial sphere that passes through the celestial poles
meanings.sent1: The colure marks the path of the stars around the North Star.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers use the colure to locate the celestial poles.
meanings.sent3: When the colure threw a party, all the stars attended!
meanings.sent4: The colure is like a cosmic hula hoop encircling the celestial poles.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the colure as a giant ring connecting the heavens above.

meanings.definition: A line of longitude passing through the celestial poles
meanings.sent1: Sailors navigated using the colure to find true north.
meanings.sent2: The colure helps determine the position of the North Star.
meanings.sent3: The colure and the equator had a race to the North Pole.
meanings.sent4: In the vast sky, the colure is the ruler measuring distances.
meanings.sent5: The colure is like a guiding thread connecting Earth to the stars.

meanings.definition: A circle on the celestial sphere that passes through the ecliptic poles
meanings.sent1: The colure intersects the ecliptic poles at two points.
meanings.sent2: Astrologers study the colure to understand the ecliptic poles.
meanings.sent3: The colure and the zodiac signs had a dance-off under the stars.
meanings.sent4: The colure is like a cosmic ribbon wrapping around the ecliptic poles.
meanings.sent5: Picture the colure as a glowing halo encircling the ecliptic poles.
